Text: Does the Participant anticipate making any additional changes to the list of Episode Initiators within the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?

Is the Participant likely to remove Clinical Episodes from the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
The Participant is on track to implement selected Care Redesign interventions within the timeframes indicated within the Care Redesign Plan.
Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Reading Hospital BPCI Advanced care redesign activities continue to be driven by system-level Clinical Effectiveness Teams (CETs) focused on redesigning clinical workflows across the acute and post-acute care settings by service line for each episode selected. The CETs are composed of physicians, nurses, ancillary staff, hospital administrators, and post-acute care providers. Each CET focuses on areas within the continuum of care, closely considering and implementing initiatives built on evidence-based medicine, beneficiary/caregiver engagement, quality and coordination of care, and care transitions.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.

The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.
Has the Participant had challenges meeting the CEHRT use requirements?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges to meeting the CEHRT use requirements.

If selected 'No' to question 4, please describe any barriers/challenges in the comment box below.

Has the Participant fully established NPRA Sharing Arrangements with all NPRA Sharing Partners? [If your response to this question is 'yes', please upload your organization's NPRA Sharing Arrangement template or a populated agreement as an example to the amendment section of the Participant Portal. If you have more than one NPRA Sharing Arrangement, upload 1 example only]
If selected 'No' to question 6, please explain noting any barriers or challenges.
Has the Participant established a BPCI Advanced Entity Agreement with a BPCI Advanced Entity?
Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: Reading Hospital (RH) has been engaged in Medicare-based NPRA since the inception of the CJR program on April 1, 2016, as it was selected as a mandatory participating hospital. RH has gained valuable experience in partnering with its independent orthopedic surgeons to share the NPRA savings and believes that such an arrangement has helped facilitate greater alignment between the physicians and the hospital. RH will utilize these proven processes and policies with other service lines as it engages with physicians in new CMS bundled payment programs.

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please provide a brief explanation of that process below.
Response: Reading Hospital has engaged ECG Management Consultants for BPCI Advanced implementation support. As part of this engagement, ECG maintains a library of all documents and conveys key activities and timelines to the Tower Health Steering Committee and ensures that knowledge is dispersed throughout the organization. In addition, Tower Health is in the process of hiring a BPCI Advanced Coordinator who will oversee implementation activities throughout the system and serve as a day to day contact.

Text: Emailed to beneficiaries - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Mailed to the beneficiary's address - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided to beneficiary during an Inpatient Hospital stay or Outpatient Visit - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided during discharge procedures - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Other - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
If selected 'Other' to question 1, please describe the communication channel used to provide beneficiary notifications.
Does the Participant use the template Beneficiary Notification Letter provided by CMS?
If selected 'No' to question 3, please explain.
Has provision of the beneficiary notification of participation resulted in negative feedback from beneficiaries?
If selected 'Yes' to question 5, what are the primary concerns from the beneficiary perspective?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected positive outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected negative outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to either question 1 or 2, please describe.
Response: There have been no unexpected positive or negative outcomes. Positive outcomes have been associated with a multidisciplinary review of current design of internal process of care and subsequent re-design to improve patient throughput, access to care, assessment and treatment. Improvements have also been recognized through the development of a robust transition of care program led by trained care navigators. The care navigators use condition-specific questionnaires to interview patients within 48 hours of hospital discharge.  Care navigators also act as liaisons between the patient and providers as indicated. In addition, we have created internal reports to monitor the required quality metrics as well as additional metrics identified during process re-design. The internal information has provided monthly data as an indicator of successful intervention or the need to re-examine the process to achieve the desired outcome.

Text: Has the Participant established a process for monitoring and mitigating unintended consequences (e.g., patient targeting/avoidance, inadequate or insufficient care, costshifting) associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model?
If selected 'Yes' to question 4, please describe.
Response: Development of patient registries as a way of identifying patients in the BPCI-A bundles. Regularly scheduled operational meeting evaluating developed clinical pathways. Quality dashboards and regular meetings reviewing quality metrics and development of actions as necessary.

Text: Has the Participant implemented a system to request, track and respond to complaints made by BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries? [The complaint process in place does not have to be solely for Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model. However the current complaint system in place must track complaints made by Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model.]
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, do you believe that current processes in place appropriately monitor and address those complaints?

Has the Participant received any complaints related to the established system for tracking Beneficiary complaints? (E.g., a beneficiary complained that their complaint was not resolved quickly enough.)

Other - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.

N/A; we have not received any complaints from Beneficiaries - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Is there a designated person(s) for submitting BPCI Advanced required documentation to CMS?
Please provide any barriers or challenges associated with submitting required documentation.
Response: Quarterly submission of the FAL and QPP has proven to be burdensome, especially since CMS have been delayed in sending out the FAiL reports. We find ourselves having to reconcile up to three different lists at a time. Given that up to 400 physicians have been eligible to participate as NPRA Sharing Partners it has taken a lot of time to submit correct documentation.

Text: Is there a designated person(s) for coordinating clinical document requests from the Participant and its Downstream Episode Initiators and other clinical partners?
Is the Participant or any of its BPCI Advanced partners under any investigations or subject to sanctions that have not been reported to CMS?
Please describe issues, challenges or barriers associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model that have not being discussed above.
Response: In addition to the burden of the quarterly FAL and QPP submissions, we continue to recommend that CMS consider the burden placed on providers. For example, CMS often requires a quick turnaround, but is often delayed in providing correct materials/data.

Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Surgeon and case manager education for cost of care sites after discharge. Multiple hospital meetings to look at the date of surgery cost of care. Looking into other data source education for the balance of cost of care, patient choice, and quality.

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: Does the Participant have a process in place related to recordsmanagement associated with BPCI Advanced Model?

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: Does the Participant have a succession plan in place for when individuals in management or individuals who oversee implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model depart the organization?

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please provide a brief explanation of that process below.
Response: We continuously prepare current staff for advancement to management roles asa succession plan for when individuals may depart the organization. In addition,we continuously search for new hires to expand the breadth and depth of ourorganization.

Text: Emailed to beneficiaries - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Mailed to the beneficiary's address - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided to beneficiary during an Inpatient Hospital stay or Outpatient Visit - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided during discharge procedures - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Other - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
If selected 'Other' to question 1, please describe the communication channel used to provide beneficiary notifications.
Response: Provided in clinical office setting prior to anchor event.

Text: Does the Participant use the template Beneficiary Notification Letter provided by CMS?
If selected 'No' to question 3, please explain.
Has provision of the beneficiary notification of participation resulted in negative feedback from beneficiaries?
If selected 'Yes' to question 5, what are the primary concerns from the beneficiary perspective?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected positive outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected negative outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to either question 1 or 2, please describe.

Has the Participant established a process for monitoring and mitigating unintended consequences (e.g., patient targeting/avoidance, inadequate or insufficient care, costshifting) associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model?
If selected 'Yes' to question 4, please describe.
Response: We continuously monitor Episode Initiator procedure, processes, and trends tooptimize model performance while also looking for the generation of untendedconsequences. Individualized reports and performance improvement plans areroutinely generated to address performance related issues.

Text: Has the Participant implemented a system to request, track and respond to complaints made by BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries? [The complaint process in place does not have to be solely for Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model. However the current complaint system in place must track complaints made by Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model.]
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, do you believe that current processes in place appropriately monitor and address those complaints?

Has the Participant received any complaints related to the established system for tracking Beneficiary complaints? (E.g., a beneficiary complained that their complaint was not resolved quickly enough.)
Quality - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Safety - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Timing and Access - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Communication - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Compassion/Caring - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Patient Rights - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Other - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.

N/A; we have not received any complaints from Beneficiaries - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Is there a designated person(s) for submitting BPCI Advanced required documentation to CMS?
Please provide any barriers or challenges associated with submitting required documentation.
Response: A challenge we have identified is the inability to have a more automatedresponse/document submission system. Having to access each BPIDindividually without an available reference point to indicate those which havebeen completed is excessively time consuming, especially with multipleEpisode Initiators.

Text: Is there a designated person(s) for coordinating clinical document requests from the Participant and its Downstream Episode Initiators and other clinical partners?
Is the Participant or any of its BPCI Advanced partners under any investigations or subject to sanctions that have not been reported to CMS?
Please describe issues, challenges or barriers associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model that have not being discussed above.
Response: Receiving timely notifications when new or updated materials become availableon the various BPCI Advanced portals or the public website.

Text: BPID
Organization Legal Name
Does the Participant have current or past experience with CMS Innovation Center models and/or Medicare demonstrations beyond BPCI Advanced?
Does the Participant have experience with value-based care beyond CMS Innovation Center models and/or Medicare demonstrations?

Has the Participant, or any of its Downstream Episode Initiators, NPRA Sharing Partners, or BPCI Advanced Entities, had a legal name change, change of control or change of tax identifier in the last year?

If selected 'Yes' to question 1, have you reported these changes to CMS? [If your response to this question is 'no', please provide written notice of changes to CMS via email (BPCIAdvanced@cms.hhs.gov). Instruction and additional information are located under Article 3 of the Participation Agreement].
Response: NA; we didn't have any changes

Text: Does the Participant anticipate making any additional changes to the list of Episode Initiators within the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
Is the Participant likely to add Clinical Episodes within the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
Is the Participant likely to remove Clinical Episodes from the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
The Participant is on track to implement selected Care Redesign interventions within the timeframes indicated within the Care Redesign Plan.
Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Each of our high priority care redesign interventions were linked to thecompletion of the eFusion Care Navigation software platform. eFusion iscurrently functional and continues to evolve concurrent with model anduser needs. As such, each of the high priority care redesigninterventions has been achieved in the time frame indicated in the CRP.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: We have no concerns regarding implementation of Care Redesign Interventions.Each general intervention is proceeding as expected. No particular barriershave been identified.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.
Has the Participant had challenges meeting the CEHRT use requirements?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges to meeting the CEHRT use requirements.
Response: The only challenge in meeting CEHRT requirements is identifying the correctversion of EHR software that qualifies based on the lengthy available listings.

Text: For Convener Participants: Has the Participant established agreements with all Downstream Episode Initiators (Acute Care Hospitals, PGPs)?
Has the Participant established agreements with all Participating Practitioners?
Has the Participant established processes, procedures and/or controls to validate and support monitoring of these agreements between the Participant and relevant partnering entities/individuals?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges in implementing process and procedures to monitor agreements or in establishing agreements with partners.
Response: The challenge is the availability of obtaining documentation from episode initiators in atimely manner.

Text: Has the Participant set up an accounting system to be used, to measure and track Net Payment Reconciliation Amounts (NPRA) received from CMS, Repayment Amounts and Excess Spending Amounts owed to CMS and Administrative Services?
Is the Participant still participating in Financial Arrangements with one or more NPRA Sharing Partners?
Does the Participant plan to do so in the future?
Response: NA; already in a financial arrangement(s)

Text: Has the Participant implemented all BPCI Advanced required processes and procedures related to NPRA Sharing? For example: processes to verify Financial Arrangements comply with all applicable laws and regulations, processes to adhere to generally accepted accounting principles, compliance plan, and others outlined within the Participation Agreement.
If selected 'No' to question 4, please describe any barriers/challenges in the comment box below.

Has the Participant fully established NPRA Sharing Arrangements with all NPRA Sharing Partners? [If your response to this question is 'yes', please upload your organization's NPRA Sharing Arrangement template or a populated agreement as an example to the amendment section of the Participant Portal. If you have more than one NPRA Sharing Arrangement, upload 1 example only]
If selected 'No' to question 6, please explain noting any barriers or challenges.
Has the Participant established a BPCI Advanced Entity Agreement with a BPCI Advanced Entity?
Response: NA; we don't have relationship with a BPCI Advanced Entity

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Text: Does the Participant plan to track and allow contribution of ICS associated with BPCI Advanced to the BPCI Advanced Savings Pool(s) in the next 12 months?
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, has the Participant established a process to measure and track Internal Cost Savings associated with BPCI Advanced?
Does the Participant plan to share NPRA associated with BPCI Advanced in the first performance period, if savings are achieved? [Performance Period 1: October 1, 2018 through June 30, 2019]
Has the Participant implemented processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please describe your processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced.
Response: All information on shared repayment amounts is derived from both monthly andreconciliation data reports. Overall performance is assessed monthly to predictanticipated shared repayment or reconciliation amounts. These predictions areshared with each Episode Initiator accordingly.

The Participant is on track to implement selected Care Redesign interventions within the timeframes indicated within the Care Redesign Plan.
Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Each of our high priority care redesign interventions were linked to thecompletion of the eFusion Care Navigation software platform. eFusion iscurrently functional and continues to evolve concurrent with model anduser needs. As such, each of the high priority care redesigninterventions has been achieved in the time frame indicated in the CRP.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: We have no concerns regarding implementation of Care Redesign Interventions.Each general intervention is proceeding as expected. No particular barriershave been identified.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.
Has the Participant had challenges meeting the CEHRT use requirements?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges to meeting the CEHRT use requirements.
Response: The only challenge in meeting CEHRT requirements is identifying the correctversion of EHR software that qualifies based on the lengthy available listings.

Has the Participant fully established NPRA Sharing Arrangements with all NPRA Sharing Partners? [If your response to this question is 'yes', please upload your organization's NPRA Sharing Arrangement template or a populated agreement as an example to the amendment section of the Participant Portal. If you have more than one NPRA Sharing Arrangement, upload 1 example only]
If selected 'No' to question 6, please explain noting any barriers or challenges.
Has the Participant established a BPCI Advanced Entity Agreement with a BPCI Advanced Entity?
Response: NA; we don't have relationship with a BPCI Advanced Entity

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please describe your processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced.
Response: All information on shared repayment amounts is derived from both monthly andreconciliation data reports. Overall performance is assessed monthly to predictanticipated shared repayment or reconciliation amounts. These predictions areshared with each Episode Initiator accordingly.

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: Does the Participant have a process in place related to recordsmanagement associated with BPCI Advanced Model?

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: Does the Participant have a succession plan in place for when individuals in management or individuals who oversee implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model depart the organization?

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please provide a brief explanation of that process below.
Response: We continuously prepare current staff for advancement to management roles asa succession plan for when individuals may depart the organization. In addition,we continuously search for new hires to expand the breadth and depth of ourorganization.

Text: Emailed to beneficiaries - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Mailed to the beneficiary's address - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided to beneficiary during an Inpatient Hospital stay or Outpatient Visit - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided during discharge procedures - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Other - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
If selected 'Other' to question 1, please describe the communication channel used to provide beneficiary notifications.
Response: Provided in clinical office setting prior to anchor event.

Text: Does the Participant use the template Beneficiary Notification Letter provided by CMS?
If selected 'No' to question 3, please explain.
Has provision of the beneficiary notification of participation resulted in negative feedback from beneficiaries?
If selected 'Yes' to question 5, what are the primary concerns from the beneficiary perspective?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected positive outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected negative outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to either question 1 or 2, please describe.

Has the Participant established a process for monitoring and mitigating unintended consequences (e.g., patient targeting/avoidance, inadequate or insufficient care, costshifting) associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model?
If selected 'Yes' to question 4, please describe.
Response: We continuously monitor Episode Initiator procedure, processes, and trends tooptimize model performance while also looking for the generation of untendedconsequences. Individualized reports and performance improvement plans areroutinely generated to address performance related issues.

Text: Has the Participant implemented a system to request, track and respond to complaints made by BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries? [The complaint process in place does not have to be solely for Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model. However the current complaint system in place must track complaints made by Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model.]
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, do you believe that current processes in place appropriately monitor and address those complaints?

Has the Participant received any complaints related to the established system for tracking Beneficiary complaints? (E.g., a beneficiary complained that their complaint was not resolved quickly enough.)
Quality - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Safety - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Timing and Access - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Communication - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Compassion/Caring - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Patient Rights - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Other - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.

N/A; we have not received any complaints from Beneficiaries - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Is there a designated person(s) for submitting BPCI Advanced required documentation to CMS?
Please provide any barriers or challenges associated with submitting required documentation.
Response: A challenge we have identified is the inability to have a more automatedresponse/document submission system. Having to access each BPIDindividually without an available reference point to indicate those which havebeen completed is excessively time consuming, especially with multipleEpisode Initiators.

Text: Is there a designated person(s) for coordinating clinical document requests from the Participant and its Downstream Episode Initiators and other clinical partners?
Is the Participant or any of its BPCI Advanced partners under any investigations or subject to sanctions that have not been reported to CMS?
Please describe issues, challenges or barriers associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model that have not being discussed above.
Response: Receiving timely notifications when new or updated materials become availableon the various BPCI Advanced portals or the public website.

Text: BPID
Organization Legal Name
Does the Participant have current or past experience with CMS Innovation Center models and/or Medicare demonstrations beyond BPCI Advanced?
Does the Participant have experience with value-based care beyond CMS Innovation Center models and/or Medicare demonstrations?

Has the Participant, or any of its Downstream Episode Initiators, NPRA Sharing Partners, or BPCI Advanced Entities, had a legal name change, change of control or change of tax identifier in the last year?

If selected 'Yes' to question 1, have you reported these changes to CMS? [If your response to this question is 'no', please provide written notice of changes to CMS via email (BPCIAdvanced@cms.hhs.gov). Instruction and additional information are located under Article 3 of the Participation Agreement].
Response: NA; we didn't have any changes

Text: Does the Participant anticipate making any additional changes to the list of Episode Initiators within the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
Is the Participant likely to add Clinical Episodes within the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
Is the Participant likely to remove Clinical Episodes from the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
The Participant is on track to implement selected Care Redesign interventions within the timeframes indicated within the Care Redesign Plan.
Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Each of our high priority care redesign interventions were linked to thecompletion of the eFusion Care Navigation software platform. eFusion iscurrently functional and continues to evolve concurrent with model anduser needs. As such, each of the high priority care redesigninterventions has been achieved in the time frame indicated in the CRP.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: We have no concerns regarding implementation of Care Redesign Interventions.Each general intervention is proceeding as expected. No particular barriershave been identified.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.
Has the Participant had challenges meeting the CEHRT use requirements?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges to meeting the CEHRT use requirements.
Response: The only challenge in meeting CEHRT requirements is identifying the correctversion of EHR software that qualifies based on the lengthy available listings.

Text: For Convener Participants: Has the Participant established agreements with all Downstream Episode Initiators (Acute Care Hospitals, PGPs)?
Has the Participant established agreements with all Participating Practitioners?
Has the Participant established processes, procedures and/or controls to validate and support monitoring of these agreements between the Participant and relevant partnering entities/individuals?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges in implementing process and procedures to monitor agreements or in establishing agreements with partners.
Response: The challenge is the availability of obtaining documentation from episode initiators in atimely manner.

Text: Has the Participant set up an accounting system to be used, to measure and track Net Payment Reconciliation Amounts (NPRA) received from CMS, Repayment Amounts and Excess Spending Amounts owed to CMS and Administrative Services?
Is the Participant still participating in Financial Arrangements with one or more NPRA Sharing Partners?
Does the Participant plan to do so in the future?
Response: NA; already in a financial arrangement(s)

Text: Has the Participant implemented all BPCI Advanced required processes and procedures related to NPRA Sharing? For example: processes to verify Financial Arrangements comply with all applicable laws and regulations, processes to adhere to generally accepted accounting principles, compliance plan, and others outlined within the Participation Agreement.
If selected 'No' to question 4, please describe any barriers/challenges in the comment box below.

Has the Participant fully established NPRA Sharing Arrangements with all NPRA Sharing Partners? [If your response to this question is 'yes', please upload your organization's NPRA Sharing Arrangement template or a populated agreement as an example to the amendment section of the Participant Portal. If you have more than one NPRA Sharing Arrangement, upload 1 example only]
If selected 'No' to question 6, please explain noting any barriers or challenges.
Has the Participant established a BPCI Advanced Entity Agreement with a BPCI Advanced Entity?
Response: NA; we don't have relationship with a BPCI Advanced Entity

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Text: Does the Participant plan to track and allow contribution of ICS associated with BPCI Advanced to the BPCI Advanced Savings Pool(s) in the next 12 months?
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, has the Participant established a process to measure and track Internal Cost Savings associated with BPCI Advanced?
Does the Participant plan to share NPRA associated with BPCI Advanced in the first performance period, if savings are achieved? [Performance Period 1: October 1, 2018 through June 30, 2019]
Has the Participant implemented processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please describe your processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced.
Response: All information on shared repayment amounts is derived from both monthly andreconciliation data reports. Overall performance is assessed monthly to predictanticipated shared repayment or reconciliation amounts. These predictions areshared with each Episode Initiator accordingly.

Text: Has the Participant completed an initial Compliance Plan? [If your response is 'yes', please upload this document to the amendment section of the Participant Portal If your Compliance Plan includes multiple appendices, you can upload the main document only.]

The Participant is on track to implement selected Care Redesign interventions within the timeframes indicated within the Care Redesign Plan.
Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Each of our high priority care redesign interventions were linked to thecompletion of the eFusion Care Navigation software platform. eFusion iscurrently functional and continues to evolve concurrent with model anduser needs. As such, each of the high priority care redesigninterventions has been achieved in the time frame indicated in the CRP.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: We have no concerns regarding implementation of Care Redesign Interventions.Each general intervention is proceeding as expected. No particular barriershave been identified.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.
Has the Participant had challenges meeting the CEHRT use requirements?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges to meeting the CEHRT use requirements.
Response: The only challenge in meeting CEHRT requirements is identifying the correctversion of EHR software that qualifies based on the lengthy available listings.

Response: The challenge is the availability of obtaining documentation from episode initiators in atimely manner.

Has the Participant fully established NPRA Sharing Arrangements with all NPRA Sharing Partners? [If your response to this question is 'yes', please upload your organization's NPRA Sharing Arrangement template or a populated agreement as an example to the amendment section of the Participant Portal. If you have more than one NPRA Sharing Arrangement, upload 1 example only]
If selected 'No' to question 6, please explain noting any barriers or challenges.
Has the Participant established a BPCI Advanced Entity Agreement with a BPCI Advanced Entity?
Response: NA; we don't have relationship with a BPCI Advanced Entity

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Has the Participant implemented processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please describe your processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced.
Response: All information on shared repayment amounts is derived from both monthly andreconciliation data reports. Overall performance is assessed monthly to predictanticipated shared repayment or reconciliation amounts. These predictions areshared with each Episode Initiator accordingly.

Has the Participant established processes, procedures and/or controls to validate and support monitoring of these agreements between the Participant and relevant partnering entities/individuals?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges in implementing process and procedures to monitor agreements or in establishing agreements with partners.
Response: The challenge is the availability of obtaining documentation from episode initiators in atimely manner.

Text: Has the Participant set up an accounting system to be used, to measure and track Net Payment Reconciliation Amounts (NPRA) received from CMS, Repayment Amounts and Excess Spending Amounts owed to CMS and Administrative Services?
Is the Participant still participating in Financial Arrangements with one or more NPRA Sharing Partners?
Does the Participant plan to do so in the future?
Response: NA; already in a financial arrangement(s)

Text: Has the Participant implemented all BPCI Advanced required processes and procedures related to NPRA Sharing? For example: processes to verify Financial Arrangements comply with all applicable laws and regulations, processes to adhere to generally accepted accounting principles, compliance plan, and others outlined within the Participation Agreement.
If selected 'No' to question 4, please describe any barriers/challenges in the comment box below.

Has the Participant fully established NPRA Sharing Arrangements with all NPRA Sharing Partners? [If your response to this question is 'yes', please upload your organization's NPRA Sharing Arrangement template or a populated agreement as an example to the amendment section of the Participant Portal. If you have more than one NPRA Sharing Arrangement, upload 1 example only]
If selected 'No' to question 6, please explain noting any barriers or challenges.
Has the Participant established a BPCI Advanced Entity Agreement with a BPCI Advanced Entity?
Response: NA; we don't have relationship with a BPCI Advanced Entity

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Text: Does the Participant plan to track and allow contribution of ICS associated with BPCI Advanced to the BPCI Advanced Savings Pool(s) in the next 12 months?
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, has the Participant established a process to measure and track Internal Cost Savings associated with BPCI Advanced?
Does the Participant plan to share NPRA associated with BPCI Advanced in the first performance period, if savings are achieved? [Performance Period 1: October 1, 2018 through June 30, 2019]
Has the Participant implemented processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please describe your processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced.
Response: All information on shared repayment amounts is derived from both monthly andreconciliation data reports. Overall performance is assessed monthly to predictanticipated shared repayment or reconciliation amounts. These predictions areshared with each Episode Initiator accordingly.

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please provide a brief explanation of that process below.
Response: We continuously prepare current staff for advancement to management roles asa succession plan for when individuals may depart the organization. In addition,we continuously search for new hires to expand the breadth and depth of ourorganization.

Provided during discharge procedures - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Other - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.

Response: Provided in clinical office setting prior to anchor event.

If selected 'Yes' to either question 1 or 2, please describe.

Has the Participant established a process for monitoring and mitigating unintended consequences (e.g., patient targeting/avoidance, inadequate or insufficient care, costshifting) associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model?
If selected 'Yes' to question 4, please describe.
Response: We continuously monitor Episode Initiator procedure, processes, and trends tooptimize model performance while also looking for the generation of untendedconsequences. Individualized reports and performance improvement plans areroutinely generated to address performance related issues.

Is there a designated person(s) for submitting BPCI Advanced required documentation to CMS?

Response: A challenge we have identified is the inability to have a more automatedresponse/document submission system. Having to access each BPIDindividually without an available reference point to indicate those which havebeen completed is excessively time consuming, especially with multipleEpisode Initiators.

Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Each of our high priority care redesign interventions were linked to thecompletion of the eFusion Care Navigation software platform. eFusion iscurrently functional and continues to evolve concurrent with model anduser needs. As such, each of the high priority care redesigninterventions has been achieved in the time frame indicated in the CRP.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.

Response: The only challenge in meeting CEHRT requirements is identifying the correctversion of EHR software that qualifies based on the lengthy available listings.

Text: Does the Participant have a process in place related to recordsmanagement associated with BPCI Advanced Model?

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: Does the Participant have a succession plan in place for when individuals in management or individuals who oversee implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model depart the organization?

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please provide a brief explanation of that process below.
Response: We continuously prepare current staff for advancement to management roles asa succession plan for when individuals may depart the organization. In addition,we continuously search for new hires to expand the breadth and depth of ourorganization.

Text: Emailed to beneficiaries - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Mailed to the beneficiary's address - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided to beneficiary during an Inpatient Hospital stay or Outpatient Visit - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided during discharge procedures - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Other - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
If selected 'Other' to question 1, please describe the communication channel used to provide beneficiary notifications.
Response: Provided in clinical office setting prior to anchor event.

Text: Does the Participant use the template Beneficiary Notification Letter provided by CMS?
If selected 'No' to question 3, please explain.
Has provision of the beneficiary notification of participation resulted in negative feedback from beneficiaries?
If selected 'Yes' to question 5, what are the primary concerns from the beneficiary perspective?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected positive outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected negative outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to either question 1 or 2, please describe.

Has the Participant established a process for monitoring and mitigating unintended consequences (e.g., patient targeting/avoidance, inadequate or insufficient care, costshifting) associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model?
If selected 'Yes' to question 4, please describe.
Response: We continuously monitor Episode Initiator procedure, processes, and trends tooptimize model performance while also looking for the generation of untendedconsequences. Individualized reports and performance improvement plans areroutinely generated to address performance related issues.

Text: Has the Participant implemented a system to request, track and respond to complaints made by BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries? [The complaint process in place does not have to be solely for Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model. However the current complaint system in place must track complaints made by Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model.]
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, do you believe that current processes in place appropriately monitor and address those complaints?

Has the Participant received any complaints related to the established system for tracking Beneficiary complaints? (E.g., a beneficiary complained that their complaint was not resolved quickly enough.)
Quality - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Safety - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Timing and Access - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Communication - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Compassion/Caring - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.

Other - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.

N/A; we have not received any complaints from Beneficiaries - Please select the categories to which complaints the Participant has received from BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries align. Please select all that apply.
Is there a designated person(s) for submitting BPCI Advanced required documentation to CMS?
Please provide any barriers or challenges associated with submitting required documentation.
Response: A challenge we have identified is the inability to have a more automatedresponse/document submission system. Having to access each BPIDindividually without an available reference point to indicate those which havebeen completed is excessively time consuming, especially with multipleEpisode Initiators.

Text: Is there a designated person(s) for coordinating clinical document requests from the Participant and its Downstream Episode Initiators and other clinical partners?
Is the Participant or any of its BPCI Advanced partners under any investigations or subject to sanctions that have not been reported to CMS?
Please describe issues, challenges or barriers associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model that have not being discussed above.
Response: Receiving timely notifications when new or updated materials become availableon the various BPCI Advanced portals or the public website.

Organization Legal Name

Does the Participant have experience with value-based care beyond CMS Innovation Center models and/or Medicare demonstrations?

Text: Does the Participant anticipate making any additional changes to the list of Episode Initiators within the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
Is the Participant likely to add Clinical Episodes within the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
Is the Participant likely to remove Clinical Episodes from the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
The Participant is on track to implement selected Care Redesign interventions within the timeframes indicated within the Care Redesign Plan.
Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Each of our high priority care redesign interventions were linked to thecompletion of the eFusion Care Navigation software platform. eFusion iscurrently functional and continues to evolve concurrent with model anduser needs. As such, each of the high priority care redesigninterventions has been achieved in the time frame indicated in the CRP.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: We have no concerns regarding implementation of Care Redesign Interventions.Each general intervention is proceeding as expected. No particular barriershave been identified.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.
Has the Participant had challenges meeting the CEHRT use requirements?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges to meeting the CEHRT use requirements.
Response: The only challenge in meeting CEHRT requirements is identifying the correctversion of EHR software that qualifies based on the lengthy available listings.

Text: For Convener Participants: Has the Participant established agreements with all Downstream Episode Initiators (Acute Care Hospitals, PGPs)?
Has the Participant established agreements with all Participating Practitioners?
Has the Participant established processes, procedures and/or controls to validate and support monitoring of these agreements between the Participant and relevant partnering entities/individuals?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges in implementing process and procedures to monitor agreements or in establishing agreements with partners.
Response: The challenge is the availability of obtaining documentation from episode initiators in atimely manner.

Text: Has the Participant set up an accounting system to be used, to measure and track Net Payment Reconciliation Amounts (NPRA) received from CMS, Repayment Amounts and Excess Spending Amounts owed to CMS and Administrative Services?
Is the Participant still participating in Financial Arrangements with one or more NPRA Sharing Partners?
Does the Participant plan to do so in the future?
Response: NA; already in a financial arrangement(s)

Text: Has the Participant implemented all BPCI Advanced required processes and procedures related to NPRA Sharing? For example: processes to verify Financial Arrangements comply with all applicable laws and regulations, processes to adhere to generally accepted accounting principles, compliance plan, and others outlined within the Participation Agreement.
If selected 'No' to question 4, please describe any barriers/challenges in the comment box below.

Has the Participant fully established NPRA Sharing Arrangements with all NPRA Sharing Partners? [If your response to this question is 'yes', please upload your organization's NPRA Sharing Arrangement template or a populated agreement as an example to the amendment section of the Participant Portal. If you have more than one NPRA Sharing Arrangement, upload 1 example only]
If selected 'No' to question 6, please explain noting any barriers or challenges.
Has the Participant established a BPCI Advanced Entity Agreement with a BPCI Advanced Entity?
Response: NA; we don't have relationship with a BPCI Advanced Entity

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Text: Does the Participant plan to track and allow contribution of ICS associated with BPCI Advanced to the BPCI Advanced Savings Pool(s) in the next 12 months?
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, has the Participant established a process to measure and track Internal Cost Savings associated with BPCI Advanced?
Does the Participant plan to share NPRA associated with BPCI Advanced in the first performance period, if savings are achieved? [Performance Period 1: October 1, 2018 through June 30, 2019]
Has the Participant implemented processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please describe your processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced.
Response: All information on shared repayment amounts is derived from both monthly andreconciliation data reports. Overall performance is assessed monthly to predictanticipated shared repayment or reconciliation amounts. These predictions areshared with each Episode Initiator accordingly.

Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Each of our high priority care redesign interventions were linked to thecompletion of the eFusion Care Navigation software platform. eFusion iscurrently functional and continues to evolve concurrent with model anduser needs. As such, each of the high priority care redesigninterventions has been achieved in the time frame indicated in the CRP.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: We have no concerns regarding implementation of Care Redesign Interventions.Each general intervention is proceeding as expected. No particular barriershave been identified.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.
Has the Participant had challenges meeting the CEHRT use requirements?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges to meeting the CEHRT use requirements.
Response: The only challenge in meeting CEHRT requirements is identifying the correctversion of EHR software that qualifies based on the lengthy available listings.

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: Does the Participant have a succession plan in place for when individuals in management or individuals who oversee implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model depart the organization?

Topic: Knowledge Management / Record Keeping / Succession Planning
Text: If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please provide a brief explanation of that process below.
Response: We continuously prepare current staff for advancement to management roles asa succession plan for when individuals may depart the organization. In addition,we continuously search for new hires to expand the breadth and depth of ourorganization.

Text: Emailed to beneficiaries - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Mailed to the beneficiary's address - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided to beneficiary during an Inpatient Hospital stay or Outpatient Visit - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Provided during discharge procedures - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
Other - What is the primary communication channel(s) used to provide beneficiary notification? Select all that applies.
If selected 'Other' to question 1, please describe the communication channel used to provide beneficiary notifications.
Response: Provided in clinical office setting prior to anchor event.

Text: Does the Participant use the template Beneficiary Notification Letter provided by CMS?
If selected 'No' to question 3, please explain.
Has provision of the beneficiary notification of participation resulted in negative feedback from beneficiaries?
If selected 'Yes' to question 5, what are the primary concerns from the beneficiary perspective?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected positive outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected negative outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to either question 1 or 2, please describe.

Has the Participant established a process for monitoring and mitigating unintended consequences (e.g., patient targeting/avoidance, inadequate or insufficient care, costshifting) associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model?
If selected 'Yes' to question 4, please describe.
Response: We continuously monitor Episode Initiator procedure, processes, and trends tooptimize model performance while also looking for the generation of untendedconsequences. Individualized reports and performance improvement plans areroutinely generated to address performance related issues.

Text: Has the Participant implemented a system to request, track and respond to complaints made by BPCI Advanced Beneficiaries? [The complaint process in place does not have to be solely for Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model. However the current complaint system in place must track complaints made by Beneficiaries in the BPCI Advanced Model.]
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, do you believe that current processes in place appropriately monitor and address those complaints?

Has the Participant received any complaints related to the established system for tracking Beneficiary complaints? (E.g., a beneficiary complained that their complaint was not resolved quickly enough.)

Is there a designated person(s) for submitting BPCI Advanced required documentation to CMS?
Please provide any barriers or challenges associated with submitting required documentation.
Response: A challenge we have identified is the inability to have a more automatedresponse/document submission system. Having to access each BPIDindividually without an available reference point to indicate those which havebeen completed is excessively time consuming, especially with multipleEpisode Initiators.

Text: Is there a designated person(s) for coordinating clinical document requests from the Participant and its Downstream Episode Initiators and other clinical partners?
Is the Participant or any of its BPCI Advanced partners under any investigations or subject to sanctions that have not been reported to CMS?
Please describe issues, challenges or barriers associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model that have not being discussed above.
Response: Receiving timely notifications when new or updated materials become availableon the various BPCI Advanced portals or the public website.

Text: Does the Participant anticipate making any additional changes to the list of Episode Initiators within the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
Is the Participant likely to add Clinical Episodes within the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
Is the Participant likely to remove Clinical Episodes from the Participant Profile effective for Model Year 3?
The Participant is on track to implement selected Care Redesign interventions within the timeframes indicated within the Care Redesign Plan.
Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Each of our high priority care redesign interventions were linked to thecompletion of the eFusion Care Navigation software platform. eFusion iscurrently functional and continues to evolve concurrent with model anduser needs. As such, each of the high priority care redesigninterventions has been achieved in the time frame indicated in the CRP.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: We have no concerns regarding implementation of Care Redesign Interventions.Each general intervention is proceeding as expected. No particular barriershave been identified.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.
Has the Participant had challenges meeting the CEHRT use requirements?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges to meeting the CEHRT use requirements.
Response: The only challenge in meeting CEHRT requirements is identifying the correctversion of EHR software that qualifies based on the lengthy available listings.

Text: For Convener Participants: Has the Participant established agreements with all Downstream Episode Initiators (Acute Care Hospitals, PGPs)?
Has the Participant established agreements with all Participating Practitioners?
Has the Participant established processes, procedures and/or controls to validate and support monitoring of these agreements between the Participant and relevant partnering entities/individuals?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges in implementing process and procedures to monitor agreements or in establishing agreements with partners.
Response: The challenge is the availability of obtaining documentation from episode initiators in atimely manner.

Text: Has the Participant set up an accounting system to be used, to measure and track Net Payment Reconciliation Amounts (NPRA) received from CMS, Repayment Amounts and Excess Spending Amounts owed to CMS and Administrative Services?
Is the Participant still participating in Financial Arrangements with one or more NPRA Sharing Partners?
Does the Participant plan to do so in the future?
Response: NA; already in a financial arrangement(s)

Text: Has the Participant implemented all BPCI Advanced required processes and procedures related to NPRA Sharing? For example: processes to verify Financial Arrangements comply with all applicable laws and regulations, processes to adhere to generally accepted accounting principles, compliance plan, and others outlined within the Participation Agreement.
If selected 'No' to question 4, please describe any barriers/challenges in the comment box below.

Has the Participant fully established NPRA Sharing Arrangements with all NPRA Sharing Partners? [If your response to this question is 'yes', please upload your organization's NPRA Sharing Arrangement template or a populated agreement as an example to the amendment section of the Participant Portal. If you have more than one NPRA Sharing Arrangement, upload 1 example only]
If selected 'No' to question 6, please explain noting any barriers or challenges.
Has the Participant established a BPCI Advanced Entity Agreement with a BPCI Advanced Entity?
Response: NA; we don't have relationship with a BPCI Advanced Entity

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.

Text: Does the Participant plan to track and allow contribution of ICS associated with BPCI Advanced to the BPCI Advanced Savings Pool(s) in the next 12 months?
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, has the Participant established a process to measure and track Internal Cost Savings associated with BPCI Advanced?
Does the Participant plan to share NPRA associated with BPCI Advanced in the first performance period, if savings are achieved? [Performance Period 1: October 1, 2018 through June 30, 2019]
Has the Participant implemented processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please describe your processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced.
Response: All information on shared repayment amounts is derived from both monthly andreconciliation data reports. Overall performance is assessed monthly to predictanticipated shared repayment or reconciliation amounts. These predictions areshared with each Episode Initiator accordingly.

Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Each of our high priority care redesign interventions were linked to thecompletion of the eFusion Care Navigation software platform. eFusion iscurrently functional and continues to evolve concurrent with model anduser needs. As such, each of the high priority care redesigninterventions has been achieved in the time frame indicated in the CRP.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: We have no concerns regarding implementation of Care Redesign Interventions.Each general intervention is proceeding as expected. No particular barriershave been identified.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.
Has the Participant had challenges meeting the CEHRT use requirements?
Please use the comment box below to describe any challenges to meeting the CEHRT use requirements.
Response: The only challenge in meeting CEHRT requirements is identifying the correctversion of EHR software that qualifies based on the lengthy available listings.

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: We believe it is important for a Participant, especially a Convener Participant,to take on risk. Most Episode Initiators, regardless of whether they are an ACH or PGP, are risk-averse and not willing to take on risk in a new endeavor that they do not completely understand. The key consideration for taking on risk is dependent on accurate data and informed decision making.
